data.overview: Brazil is about tides, trade winds, and flag colors. Pace days around swell reports and plan indoor breaks when UV peaks.

top_sights.title: Protected reef snorkel
top_sights.why_go: Calm morning water with reef rangers explaining coral etiquette.

top_sights.title: Brazil lookout trail
top_sights.why_go: Clifftop views of coves and quick weather readouts from lifeguards.

top_sights.title: Harbor night market
top_sights.why_go: Fresh catch tastings and local musicians; great for cooler evenings.

itineraries.title: 2–3 Day Highlights
stops: Hire marine biologist for reef drift
Cooking class focused on coastal spice blends

seasonality.pros: Plenty of space on popular beaches
seasonality.cons: Some ferry routes on limited schedules

local_tips: Check daily flag colors—red or double-red closes swimming regardless of calm looks.
Bring reef-safe sunscreen and long-sleeve rash guards; UV index stays high until 4pm.
Review BR visa-on-arrival rules; island chains often require proof of onward travel.
safety: Respect lifeguard whistles immediately; undertows swing fast after storms.
Avoid feeding wildlife such as reef fish or iguanas—fines are enforced.
Register boat rentals with harbor master so radios stay monitored.

transport.from_airport: Airport shuttle counters sell coastal transfers; aim for early flights to beat traffic.
transport.getting_around: Beach cruisers, tuk-tuks, and ferries link most bays; rideshare handles late nights.
transport.passes: Regional ferry passes cover multi-island hops within 5 days.
